info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 3:35PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Line of showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact the north and central Willamette Valley through 415 PM PDT... At 330 PM PDT, a line of showers and a few thunderstorms extended from Forest Grove southward to Newberg to Dayton to Falls City. This line is moving to the east at 15 mph, and will likely move across Interstate 5 between Portland and the Turner Hills near Salem around 4 pm. HAZARD...Heavy downpours, wind gusts up to 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, Hillsboro, McMinnville, Dallas, south and west side of Portland metro area, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, Newberg, Forest Grove, Wilsonville, Monmouth, Independence, Dayton, Turner, Amity, and Aurora. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 243 and 293. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding of water in low-lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
